title: Reddit is making sitewide protests basically impossible
post_content:
📰 SPOTLIGHT: Reddit is making sitewide protests basically impossible

✨ Reddit is giving its staff a lot more power over the communities on its platform. Starting today, Reddit moderators will not be able to change if their subreddit is public or private without first submitting a request to a Reddit admin. The policy applies to adjusting all community types, meaning moderators will have to request to make a switch from safe for work to not safe for Work, too. By requiring admin approval for the changes, Reddit is taking away a lever many communities used to protest the company’s API pricing changes last year. By going private, the community becomes inaccessible to the public, making the platform less usable for the average visitor.“The ability to instantly change Community Type settings has been used to break the platform and violate our rules,” Reddit VP of community Laura Nestler writes in a post on r/modnews.

The lawsuit revolves around Samsung’s “Auto Blocker” feature, which now comes turned-on-by-default on new Samsung phones. title: Ford targets EV ‘fence-sitters’ with offer of free home charger and installation
post_content:
🚨 BREAKING: Ford targets EV ‘fence-sitters’ with offer of free home charger and installation

📄 Ford is offering a free home charger for customers who buy or lease an all-electric vehicle. The company will also cover the costs of standard installation. Ford says it's the only company offering the free charger and installation. The free charger is a $1,310 Level 2 charger that comes with a standard CCS1 connector. Ford will also offer 24/7 call and text support for all EV owners who may have questions or concerns about their new purchase. It is also emphasizing its Blue Oval Charging Network, which includes a number of third-party charging providers, as well as the Tesla Supercharger network.. Ford is struggling to get more customers to consider switching to electric vehicles. “We have a lot of customers open to electric,” said Martin Delonis, senior manager of strategy at Ford Model e, “but they’re sitting on the fence.” Most customers overestimate how much range they will need.

title: We tested six smart rings, and there’s a clear winner
post_content:
🚨 LATEST: We tested six smart rings, and there’s a clear winner

✨ Oura Ring, Ultrahuman Ring Air, Circular Slim, Samsung Galaxy Ring, RingConn, and Evie Ring are all smart rings. Oura Ring has a clever-gap design, which means it doesn’t matter if your fingers bloat or gain a few pounds. The next ring on the chopping block is the $269 EvieRing, but it hurts me to write this because it’s the prettiest and most comfortable of the six. Most smart rings tend to be indistinguishable from one, but the first-gen design and comfort were the only factors that would win it off. If you’re not accurate and syncing is a chore, what is the point of a smart ring? It’d be one thing if this was a one-off. It was not. Most people want smart rings for health tracking. But the real kicker is the charger is an easily misplaced USB stick. Easily my least favorite of the bunch.

title: College students used Meta’s smart glasses to dox people in real time
post_content:
📰 EXCLUSIVE: College students used Meta’s smart glasses to dox people in real time

🗣️ Harvard students have created an eerie demo of how smart glasses can use facial recognition tech to instantly dox people’s identities. The most unsettling part is the demo uses current, widely available technology like the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses. Facial recognition tech has been frighteningly accurate for a while now, and I-XRAY is largely just chaining together a bunch of existing technologies. It relies in part on PimEyes, which The New York Times described in 2022 as an “alarmingly accurate” face search engine that “anyone can use.” The students say their goal is to raise awareness that all this isn’t some dystopian future — it's all possible now with existing technology. The Verge reached out to Meta for comment, which reiterated the same guidance as its terms of service.

title: Sonos has a plan to earn back your trust, and here it is
post_content:
⚡️ ANNOUNCEMENT: Sonos has a plan to earn back your trust, and here it is

🔍 Sonos is extending its manufacturer warranty by an additional year for select products that are still under warranty right now. CEO Patrick Spence has admitted that with the new app, Sonos moved too fast and failed to recognize the full gravity of bugs, missing features, and reduced functionality that led to an overwhelmingly negative reception upon its debut in May. Sonos says major changes to its app will now be released gradually and that customers can opt in to test new features. In contrast to the automated app release we issued in May, any major change to the Sonos app will be allowing customers to adjust the scope and provide feedback before it becomes the default. For new features, we will introduce an opt-in experimental option in the app for customers who would like to participate in testing them. For everyone whose trust in the company has been shaken, that’s at least evidence that Sonos has learned a critical lesson.
